storyInfo: Carmen and Kal'tsit, who arrive at the Eye of Iberia, see the hero who has fallen in battle. The Seaborn, having received an offering, spreads the Silence once more with its song. The fight seems to be slipping into the abyss of failure, and the decisive battle is imminent.

attributes.content: The Eye of Iberia. It's been a long, long time since I last set foot here.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Countless soldiers from the Penal Battalion laid down their lives here. And when the Seaborn finally broke through our defense line, countless engineers died in vain inside the lighthouse.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Before our last ship was swallowed, we fled. For every ten men who left home, hardly one returned.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: But now, behold.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Light!
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Carmen's voice trembles for the first time in an eternity.
Kal'tsit stares silently out into the center of the distant reef. A massive lighthouse illuminates the entire sky, as bright as the day.
I don't see the ship.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: That is a good sign. It proves they found what they were looking for.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Let's proceed. As long as this light is not extinguished, we will press forward.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: (Slithers around the main door)
attributes.name: Sea Terror

attributes.content: ...Mon3tr.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Screeches)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Clear the way. We're going in.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The heat of fire.
The Sea Terrors gather around the main door, wandering, spinning.
Carmen's eyes sweep into the distance. They follow a line of the charred corpses of these abominations the entire way, their remains vanishing with the wind.
The Sea Terrors do not feel fear.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: But they do know how to seek advantage and avoid disadvantage. Their base instincts have taught them to hunt cautiously.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...They have been taught fear. These creatures may not know what a country is, let alone laws and morals.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: But they have learned to fear the High Inquisitor. They have learned to fear everything we have built on top of civilization.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Dario!
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Kal'tsit does not say anything.
She can see. She can see a strange ring on a patch of fluorescent ground.
Charred corpses are stacked high into a mountain. The deaths of tens of thousands of their kin had imprinted a new behavior upon the Sea Terrors—
—Do not approach the lighthouse.
A feeble flame still flickers. It was originally a great bonfire.
Before the Sea Terrors had perished in a tide of death, there was nothing flammable here at all.
At the heart of the flame stands a single man. He lifts his lantern and leans on his sword, just as he did when he learned to stand guard in his youth—motionless.
You've done well, Dario.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Be at peace now.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: The lantern in Dario's hand seems to echo Carmen's farewell. In an instant, the fire swallows even more Sea Terrors before the raging flame then wraps around the silent High Inquisitor.
His already-clouded eyes are still gazing far into the distance.
Carmen remains silent for a long time before Dario's statue-like body.
Kal'tsit does not interrupt Carmen's mourning. She only takes in the scene with her eyes. There aren't many signs of the Hunters' activity here.
The High Inquisitor remained here alone, staving off the surging tides of Sea Terrors until his life was spent.
But even if the soldier's lifeforce had bled dry long ago, the Sea Terrors still feared him. Because his flame had not extinguished, because his light had not dimmed.
The Inquisitor had turned himself into a force of nature, a pledge to defend the sanctity of the Eye of Iberia even beyond death.
After a long time, Carmen lifts his head.

Only then does Kal'tsit see the signs of age in the old man in front of her. Though the Inquisition had used various methods to prolong his life, in this moment he could no longer hide the fatigue in his eyes.
He turns his head and looks towards Kal'tsit, then back to Dario, who was gradually disappearing into the flame.
He was my finest student, Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: We have three minutes to mourn the death of this soldier. Once the flames go out, nothing will stand between the Sea Terrors and their nest. They will swarm this place.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Also, I didn't see the girl. At least his disciple survived.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Are there no higher-level Seaborn here?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Doesn't seem so, for the time being.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Their numbers are nothing to be feared then.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: 'For the time being.'
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: We ought to find a more permanent solution. The Eye of Iberia was built by Breogan. It has the potential to become the hub for establishing a link with Ægir.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Assuming they were able to find the ship... Wait, hold on.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Who reactivated the Eye of Iberia? Neither the Ægir nor Dario should've had any experience with this.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: ...Look up there.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Ugh... Finally...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: *pant*... *pant*... Th-The control panel is fine...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Phew, I'm totally worn out...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: (Hums curiously)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Hwaaaaah—!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Y-You're—
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: ...I must admit, you've surpassed my expectations.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You managed to re-light the Eye of Iberia by yourself, restoring at least thirty percent of its functionality.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You did this, alone. Under these conditions.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You... You're the one Mr. Elysium mentioned. Oh!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Wh-What about Mr. Inquisitor?! He's been fighting for his life down there this entire time and I, I didn't dare get close to him since I wouldn't be able to help anyway, so all I could do was keep an eye on the control panel here...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: He made the ultimate sacrifice.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: What...?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: But by no means was it in vain. He sacrificed himself for his faith, and as such, will now live on forever.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: He died heroically as an Inquisitor, as a vindicator of Iberia. His ideal self shall be forever enshrined on the coasts of Iberia.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: And then there is you, Ægir. You have defended the purpose of his sacrifice. You have persisted all this time, and never given up.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: You've done well.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: I-I never got to talk to him much, but... he... *sob*...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Um... what about Gran Faro? What's going to happen to my home?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: ...I usually don't answer every question from the general public.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: But for now, I don't intend to lie to you. Gran Faro will soon be under the management of the Penal Battalion. The citizens will all come under their unified control, and contribute to the construction of frontline checkpoints.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Also... Thiago died at the hands of heretics.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: No!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: H-How could this happen? Uncle Thiago, is he really—?!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: He had long been aware of the Church of the Deep's cultists, yet turned a blind eye to them. His cover-up thwarted the plans of the Penal Battalion, and delayed our ability to send support here.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Even if he'd escaped death, he would not have escaped me, child.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Jordi collapses limply onto the ground.
He feels numb and exhausted. He feels like the single string supporting him through everything that happened, long worn thin, had suddenly snapped.
Uncle Thiago... Why?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: ...Mon3tr, guard the entrance.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Obeys cheerfully)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Can you confirm where the Stultifera Navis was last seen?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Dame Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Not that far. And the last signal came less than forty-eight hours ago.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: What...?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: She's still able to send signals?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Breogan helped the Iberian royal family construct lighthouses and fleets. Why, if not for restoring a connection to his homeland?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Be it the Eye of Iberia or some transponder hidden in a corner in the Stultifera Navis, they all use the Ægir's technology without reservation.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Of course, all of this assumes that the Seaborn haven't already destroyed the ship or turned it into their nest.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Carmen's eyes silently follow the direction of the light extending towards the horizon.
The Stultifera Navis cannot be seen by the naked eye. The ocean is too expansive, and what's not too far for a ship is still a cruel joke to those on land.
The weary saint once again shows his age. His lips quiver, as if innumerable thoughts are crossing through his mind.
Alfonso... Garcia... Touré... Julia...
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Are you still out there?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: My captain and Gladiia pursued it into the sea.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: We should go help them.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: No, we'd be better off waiting here. The waters are restless, and the Seaborns' scents swirl together. There's probably more than just one.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Did you hear something, Skadi?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: What? No, I didn't.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I see.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: What have you done to this place?!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: You, Ægirs, how'd you get in here?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: I was the only one with the key, and when the ol' deadbeat kicked the bucket, I threw it into the ocean! It's been fifty years already!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: If this is the power source for the vessel, wouldn't locking it up mean giving up hope?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: The ol' deadbeat was the last engineer we had. When he died, we had nobody left who could fix the ship.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: To make matters worse, we were already tangled up in the Seaborn, and couldn't get away. Didn't need anyone rocking the boat on my watch.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: But answer me! How'd you find this place?!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Breogan. The captain followed the clues he left, which led to Iberia, then here.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: You people... you know the shipwright?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Nope, not at all. I've always been more into the arts anyway.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: But it really shouldn't come as a surprise. To return to Ægir, we must follow the trail of the Ægir—
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: —What's this?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Ah, you've even gotten your hands dirty digging up some of Breogan's personal belongings... Hasn't Ægir ever heard of respecting people's privacy?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: What does it say?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Breogan's experiences on land. A travel log, I guess?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Is this what the Captain's been looking for?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: No clue. Why don't you ask her yourself?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: ...Just a small part of it.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Returning empty handed, eh?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: It disappeared.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Furthermore, the reason we didn't chase any further is because there were signs of other Seaborn nearby.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: They came here following distant scents and the calls of their kin.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Now, I don't mind skipping straight to the slaughter. But we should resolve the problem of this ship first.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: You dare treat my Iberia as a prize to be taken?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: This ship is the only way for us to return to Ægir. And only it can contact our cities.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: As for the issue of repairs, perhaps I might be more qualified than a handful of backwards Iberians who know little of Breogan's technology.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: I can't pass up this opportunity, even if we must resort to force.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Two against four, eh?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: (Howls vigilantly) —
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: Three against three.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: ...Captain?!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Not so fast, Gladiia.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Don't forget what I said.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: ...You never gave me a reason to give up on returning to Ægir.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: I'm telling you, you don't know what it's like there now.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: The Seaborn have never taken the initiative to attack our cities unless their nests and living spaces were threatened. Each act of slaughter, each act of destruction, has been fueled by the Ægir's degeneracy.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: They thought we were dead. They lost contact with us. The blood of the Seaborn flow within us.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: In all our long years of battling against these enemies, we finally have a prime opportunity.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: And you think these few acts of 'degeneracy' have nothing to do with the scum we fight? Even if left alone, the Seaborn's living spaces will grow like a tumor until the entire ocean is devoured.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: This and that are two separate issues.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Neither of which can be solved by heading home, rejoining the army, and marching forth once more.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Why don't we try thinking outside the box this time?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: So you've chosen to listen to those lowly beasts, to walk with them, to understand them.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: They call us their kin, but what do we know about them? Far too little.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: I can hardly even understand what I've seen myself. Until we've obtained definite answers about their gods, everything we do is uselessly groping around in the dark.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: What are you talking about, Captain?!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: You... You and the Seaborn... How do we know you're still on our side? Why do you have to...
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Every Hunter who thought they could get something out of the Seaborn has ended up disappearing.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Of course, you should understand that better than me.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Their whispers... resonate... They will invade your mind. Those are not your thoughts!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: ...Skadi.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: That's... also a separate issue. I'll let Gladiia give you the specifics.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Ship captain, escort them away.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: I was just thinking the same thing, Ægir.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: ...What a pity.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Stillness. Silence. Hunters long separated always seem to have the least pleasant of reunions.
Something squirms in the hearts of Skadi and Specter. The chief mate hesitates, its wounds still aching.
Swords are drawn, bowstrings stretched taut.
Quiet.
Too quiet.
Wait, how is this possible? The rushing of the waves, the howling of the wind, the creaking sounds of the hull being torn open by Seaborn—
They all become distant.
Hunters!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Th-The ship is sailing!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Nonsense, Old Iberian. Just how many years do you think—
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: No, I swear it's true! Something's pushing the ship, and... it might've been pushing the ship the whole time we were chasing after the Seaborn.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: And... from the very beginning, um...
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Our surroundings have been unusually quiet.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: *Huff*...
attributes.name: Rocinante

attributes.content: Kin, gather. Take this cell, and go far away.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: Follow... We will follow. We will find the end of the storm.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: (Shakes head meekly)
attributes.name: Rocinante

attributes.content: The waves are fading.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: Silence, is coming.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: I don't hear anything at all. After so many years of the waves washing against us, why...?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Everything, is just like that day...
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: (Cowers in pain and suffering)
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: Garcia! Ugh... My hand, it's shaking... Damn it, if I didn't need it to hunt, I would've lopped this thing off a long time ago.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: What's the meaning of this, Ægir?!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Gladiia does not answer.
She imperceptibly reaches for her neck. The scales, the part of her that do not belong to her, are resonating with something.
The scent of the Seaborn... The smell of the ocean, it's all gone. Look outside. It's way too peaceful.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: How could this be?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Haah... What's going on? Why's it so quiet?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: ...Wait.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Did you hear that? What was that?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Was there something—
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: 'The ocean sank into an unprecedented silence. Anomalies appeared across the shore, as violently ebbing tides and irregular waves heralded the coming of disaster.'
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: 'All sounds were smothered. From waves crashing against the shore to the chiming of city clock towers, all noise faded away.'
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Until the voices of the people all disappeared as well.
Until the wind was stilled.
The Profound Silence came without a sound.
Impossible, it's just like in the Inquisition's records. Are we facing... another Silence?!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Shark, where are you going?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Heading up to check things out.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: I'll go with you.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Me too.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: No, Skadi.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: You and Gladiia stay here.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: ...Skadi.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Stay with Gladiia, and remember this one thing.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: You will always be our Hunter.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Laurentina, let's go.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Specter lifts her head towards the sky.
The dark clouds know not when to dissipate, but she, who has lost the concept of time, finds a sea of stars in the sky.
She can finally hear that voice.
The voice that calls out to her.
Specter paces around the deck, and Ulpianus casts her a concerned glance for just a moment.
You and the captain have a keen sense of smell. Can you sense any Seaborn around us?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: No, right now, there is little difference between here and the land.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Even though we're clearly floating out at sea. It's disconcerting.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: I'll head the other way to see if we're really being pushed by a current.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: ...See you soon.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: O starry sky.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: This is the first time in many years I've seen the stars so clearly.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: I had forgotten so many things. I forgot my home, was used by others, and what finally saved my life and awakened my memories was the part of me I hated most.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Accepting that I'm a freak actually wasn't as hard as it sounds. That's what makes me unique.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: The one, final thing I am unable to let go of... is my home.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: But have I really returned? Is this place on the sea's surface really Ægir? Is this still my home?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Just because Gladiia never said it doesn't mean I wouldn't realize. It wouldn't be the first time rifts have grown between Hunters, but between us and Ægir? We've been separated by the shore for too long.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: ...I remember something else.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: When I was little, I once went with my parents and grandparents to watch the stars on the ocean's surface adorn the sky, on a day much like this. Even the most beautiful pearl geode couldn't compare to that splendor.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: In retrospect, even after I became a Hunter, I was always leaving my home again and again, but never reaching anywhere else.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Haha... I suppose I'm getting a bit homesick.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Where are you going to take me this time, Amaia?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Under the magnificent starry sky, the creature quietly looks down on Specter.
It makes not a single sound. The ship splitting the waves, the wind's bluster. All sounds are drowned out by His soft murmurs.
He hovers in the air as if walking on water, gently kissing the light of the stars and moons, His tentacles coruscating in a beautiful array.
Nowhere, Laurentina. The ocean is boundless, and wherever we go is all the same.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: I've always been able to hear your song, Amaia.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Laurentina, that is the name of our scaleless kin, the Liberi, the Iberian.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: As I consumed her, she kept stroking my head. She spoke to me of many things. Time itself was like frozen dust, an eternity seeming to pass as I listened to her.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Until she could no longer speak, until even her bones were digested by our smallest kin, she nurtured me with both nutrition and time. She taught me everything I know.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Since when were you so sentimental towards your food?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Such was her request, I merely granted it. If there is purpose to such emotions, we are willing to experiment.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: What of Ishar'mla? Gladiia? And... Ulpianus?
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Are your kin ready to return to the great sea?
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: ...We've had a bit of an internal disagreement.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Why? Your home is clearly right before your eyes. We many are clearly right here awaiting you.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: You're homesick, Laurentina. Amaia told me that, of all the Ægir she ever made contact with, you harbor the greatest affection for Ægir itself.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Come.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Embrace me, and I will bring you back home.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: You know, I've never touched a living Seaborn before. I prefer your kind dead.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Just as you prefer to give shape to inorganic matter, even though it offers nothing for your survival?
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Do you have any other pursuits other than 'survival'?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Pursuits? Like your pursuit to return home?
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: The survival of our kind. The survival of more of us. The survival of we many.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: All beings ought to form a single entity. Life should not be so disorderly.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: The Seaborn descends onto the deck.
Specter laughs.
You're a graceful one. Did Amaia teach you that as well?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: It was just her request. A memento.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: I suppose that means you'll be paying back both of our debts?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: ...Ah, before her death, Amaia entrusted you to me. I will make use of your life. I will also fulfill your requests.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Amaia thanks you. She said I should help you. Because of you, their work was able to take another step forward. Their 'research' and 'ideals' have all advanced greatly.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: I can talk to you about Ishar'mla. I can take you back to Ægir. I can share with you where our kind are, and how they are doing. I can name your clansmen who are trying to become one with us.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Amaia begged me to help you. Only through helping you, will you accept us as kin.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: ...Hah.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: In that case, my first request is...
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Stop singing. I want to hear the wind of my hometown.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Very well.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: In an instant, the wind and the waves return to Specter's ears.
Just as the sound of the first waves splashing against the deck rings out clearly, Ulpianus's giant blade is already poised above the Seaborn's head.
Die.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: What—?! It managed to block? —Nngh!
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Ulpianus!
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: A sufficiently heavy blow. Our kin in the ocean will welcome his unconscious form. They will take him back to our nest, where we will spend time becoming one with him.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: As for this floating box... it has been used to house our kin who have not yet adapted to the sea. But most of them died, and the rest have refused to become one with us.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Therefore, it is no longer needed.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Specter is unable to see the Seaborn's movements, but like a piece of garbage being swept aside by a pedestrian, the once-glorious cannon mounted on the ship vanishes in the blink of an eye.
A few seconds later, an enormous splash in the distance reveals where the steel construct had gone.
(How did it manage to slice off that cannon? With its tail?!)
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Shit—
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Specter's eyes are unable to follow.
Whether shaken by the ease with which Ulpianus was repelled, or distracted by the sound of the metal cannon being sliced through, Specter is easily struck and sent crashing into the deck.
She was unable to see the attack at all.
Come, let us return to the sea.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Whether to hunt, or to communicate, or to evolve, we must all return to the sea.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Halt!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: You trying to take apart my ship, you monster?!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Garcia!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: (Roars) —!
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: The chief mate charges at the Seaborn.
But before even laying a finger on that elegant being, the chief mate's movements suddenly freeze.
Kin. This is kin.
I am attacking my own kind?
What a paradoxical being. You have consumed many of our kin, yet many more go hungry. You ought to feed them.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Turn into nutrients, and nourish our kind.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Garcia!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: What are you doing to my chief mate?!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: —Ugh!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Gaah... Goddamnit!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Don't worry, I'm alright... *cough*.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Alfonso...
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: What is it...?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Wait, hold on, what?! Garcia, you—
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Alfonso.
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: Today is... the last day... of our voyage.
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: All these years... I... always treated myself as... a monster. Easier... that way.
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: I know. If I die... you'll be lonely... and then you'll die. You shouldn't... die... so I'm... worthless.
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: Today is the last day... of our voyage.
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: I... I think I already... feel kinship towards it.
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: No! No!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Garcia! You can still talk! You're still yourself!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: Time... is up. The Stultifera... will soon sink. The fluorescent sea has already started... to corrode the ship.
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: I—
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: —Will fight to the death, as an Iberian. I will never... accept it as my kin.
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: The Seaborn has already bent down.
It looks hardly any different from the greatest chief mate Iberia has ever known.
Garcia nudges the shining crown sitting atop its head.
(Iberian) My beloved... Remember... your duty.
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: (Roars) —
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: You are not fighting me, Garcia.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Graaaaah—
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: You are fighting we many inside your heart. You are on this ship, but you thirst for the sea.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Urgh— Hraaaagh—
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: But it doesn't matter.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Become sustenance, and nourish our kin. Or, become one with us.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: The Chief Mate's body is punctured, blood gushing out like a spring.
The Seaborn tosses Garcia overboard into the ocean, like chucking out bait.
It gazes from above, noble and impassive, like an inviolable eikon.
What... What just happened?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: How could it so easily—
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Human, kin, and all living things in between.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Amaia wishes to correct you. And thus, it shall be done. I simply welcome back my kin, and welcome back Ishar-mla.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Protect the lives of our kin. Then, return to we many. 'Return home.'
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Shark.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Gladiia effortlessly steps forward, casting off the gentle beckoning from behind.
In the space of a moment, Skadi, who had been standing behind her, and Specter, once again returning to battle, react in sync and brandish their weapons at the Seaborn.
As the fastest of the group, Gladiia would improve the synergy between the three if she slowed down a bit—but she had already lost the capacity to stay calm.
It dodges. Or more accurately, it simply takes a step forward, but its speed is sufficient.
It has its eyes only on Skadi.
There are many among us who wish to see you. Ishar-mla. Ishar'mla.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Our kind awaits you. We await you. We hope you will answer our call.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Filth, is there no end to your arrogance?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Gladiia whirls her lance at the Seaborn, but it does not evade. It is run through, its body easily lifted and smashed down into a deep pit.
No good... What's happened to your body?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Soon, many kin, many kin in need, will reach my heights.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: We are changing every day. Gladiia. We are one whole. You are of the strongest batch.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: ...Where's my captain?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Tossed into the sea. He was injured pretty badly.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Even their gods were unable to devour Ulpianus. He won't die so easily.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Its body seems to have undergone some changes. It's nothing like the trash we encountered in Sal Viento.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Swordfish? Treating an enemy with caution rather than contempt? Maybe I'm still missing some memories, but does that ever happen, Skadi?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: No, you're right, it is rare. But Seaborn like this were also rare. What kind of prey stands before three Hunters and remains unscathed?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: To be fair, I've barely done anything yet.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: The ship won't hold out if we keep fighting like this, though. It's grown much stronger.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: ...Just the last few blows have already set the lowest deck on fire.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: How dare you treat Garcia and my ship like this! I'll make you regret this, monster.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Please, my kin, even more of our kin call out to me, asking me to maintain the ocean's growth and tranquility.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: If you get in my way, I have no choice but to consume you. I beg of you, return to our kind.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Hey, Amaia.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: ...If you insist on calling me that.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Sure do. Anyway, I just remembered something which REALLY should've been written into those Scriptures—
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: She still owes me her life, and you're going to pay it back.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: A debt? If you are willing to return to our kind, I will grant you that.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: No can do.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: The Seaborn does not answer.
It silently leans forward, baring its claws.
In an instant, the damage to the ship's hull passes a critical threshold, and everything in sight shakes violently.
...Minutes. Yes, your kind's conception of time. Amaia spoke of this before.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Ten minutes.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: In ten minutes this box will be surrounded by our kin. It will 'sink.'
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Hunt and consume. Survive and evolve.
It has never hesitated.
